sen.j: 丹波口駅（たんばぐちえき）は、京都府京都市下京区中堂寺南町にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）山陰本線（嵯峨野線）の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Chudoji Minami-machi, Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Tambaguchi Station is a stop on San'in Main Line (Sagano Line) of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Tambaguchi Station, located in Chudoji Minami-machi, Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the San'in Main Line (Sagano Line) of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Tanbaguchi Station, located in Chudoji Minami-machi, Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Sanin Main Line (Sagano Line) of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
sen.cmt: Tambaguchi →Tanbaguchi としました。アポストロフィーを削除し、Sanin としました。

sen.j: 山陰本線以外にも、梅小路駅からの東海道本線貨物支線（通称：山陰連絡線）が乗り入れる（但し、現在同線を経由する定期列車は京都総合運転所～嵯峨嵐山駅間の毎日1往復の錆取り列車のみであり、旅客運行はない）。
sen.e: In addition to San'in Main Line, the Umekoji Station-originated line for cargo branched from the Tokaido main line, so-called San'in-connecting line) also uses this station (however, at present, the trains regularly operated via this line are only a daily rust-removing one between Kyoto Sogountensho (the rail yard of JR West in Kyoto) and Saga-Arashiyama Station, with no passenger train operated on the line).

In addition to the San'in Main Line, the Umekoji Station-originated line for cargo that branches from the Tokaido main line, or the so-called San'in-connecting line) also uses this station (however, at present the trains regularly operated via this line are only a daily rust-removing one between Kyoto Sogountensho (the rail yard of JR West in Kyoto) and Saga-Arashiyama Station, so no passenger trains operate on the line).

In addition to the Sanin Main Line, the Umekoji Station-originated line for freight that branches from the Tokaido main line (or the so-called Sanin-connecting line) also uses this station (however, at present the trains regularly operated via this line are only a daily rust-removing one between Kyoto Sogountensho (the rail yard of JR West in Kyoto) and Saga-Arashiyama Station, so no passenger trains operate on the line).
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーを削除し、Sanin としました。cargo →freightに変更しました。

sen.j: 同線は当駅の京都駅寄りで山陰本線に合流している。
sen.e: The line is connected to San'in Main Line on the Kyoto side of ths station.
The line is connected to the San'in Main Line on the Kyoto side of the station.
The line is connected to the Sanin Main Line on the Kyoto side of the station.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーを削除し、Sanin としました。

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅（相互利用可能ICカードはICOCAの項を参照）。
sen.e: In this station, ICOCA/J-through cards can be used (for interchangeably usable IC cards, refer to ICOCA).
In this station, ICOCA/J-through cards can be used (for interchangeably usable IC cards, refer to ICOCA).
In this station, ICOCA/J-through cards can be used (for interchangeably usable IC cards, refer to ICOCA).

sen.j: JRの特定都区市内制度における「京都市内」の駅である。
sen.e: This station is included in the ones in the "Kytoo city area" in the special city area system of JR.
This station is included among those in the "Kyoto city area" in the special city-area system of JR.
This station is included among those in the 'Kyoto city area' in the JR railway fare system of specific metropolitan and urban areas.
sen.cmt: 「特定都区市内制度」の表現を変更しました。

sen.j: かつての平安京の朱雀大路の跡を南北に走る山陰本線が、五条通（国道9号）と交差する位置にある。
sen.e: This station is located at the place where San'in Main Line, running in the north-south direction along the Suzaku-Oji street in the Heian-Kyo era, crosses Gojo-dori Street (National Highway Route 9).

This station is located at the place where the San'in Main Line, running in the north-south direction along the Suzaku-Oji street dating from the Heian-Kyo era, crosses Gojo-dori Street (National Highway Route 9).

This station is located at the place where the Sanin Main Line, running in the north-south direction along the Suzaku-Oji Street dating from the Heian-kyo era, crosses Gojo-dori Street (National Route 9).
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーを削除し、Sanin としました。Suzaku-Oji Street, Heian-kyo としました。

sen.j: 駅名は京の七口の一つ「丹波口」に由来する。
sen.e: The name of the station comes from "Tambaguchi," one of the seven entrances to Kyoto, so-called "Kyo-no-Nanakuchi"
The name of the station comes from "Tambaguchi," one of the seven entrances to Kyoto, or the so-called "Kyo-no-Nanakuchi."
The name of the station comes from 'Tanbaguchi,' one of the seven entrances to Kyoto, or the so-called Kyo-no-Nanakuchi.

sen.j: 1面2線のプラットホーム形状と配置を有する行き違い可能な高架駅。
sen.e: An elevated station where, with a platform serving two tracks, two trains going in opposite directions with each other can be served at the same time.
It is an elevated station where, with a platform serving two tracks, two trains going in opposite directions with each other can be served at the same time.
It is an elevated station where, with a platform serving two tracks, two trains going in opposite directions with each other can be served at the same time.

sen.j: 改札口は1ヶ所のみ。
sen.e: The entrance/exit gates are provided at one location.
The entrance/exit gates are provided at one location.
The ticket gates are provided at one location.
sen.cmt: 改札口→ticket gates としました。

sen.j: ジェイアール西日本交通サービスが駅業務を受託する鉄道駅業務委託駅であり、早朝・深夜に窓口非営業の時間帯がある。
sen.e: The operation of this station is entrusted to JR West Kotsu Service, and counter services for passengers are not provided in some of the early morning and mid-night hours.
The station's operations are entrusted to JR West Kotsu Service, but counter services for passengers aren't provided in some of the early morning and late-night hours.
The station's operations are entrusted to JR West Kotsu Service, but counter services for passengers aren't provided in some of the early morning and late-night hours.

sen.j: 改札口には、いわゆる反転フラップ式案内表示機があり、その駅名には往年の山陰線長距離列車の名残を垣間見ることもできた（京都方面の行き先の表示は、京都方面の当駅に停車する営業列車が京都行きしかないため、パタパタ式ではなく「京都」に固定されていた）が、2008年2月頃に電光掲示板に代わった。
sen.e: Formerly, a flipping and flapping-type train information display board was provided at the entrance/exit gate and you were able to find, in the station names on the board, slight vestiges concering former long-distanc trains on the San'in line (because all trains in the direction of Kyoto that stopped at this station were bound for Kyoto, the display was fixed to "Kyoto" without being flapped), but the board was replaced with an electronic bulletin board around in February of 2008.

Formerly, a flipping/flapping type of train information display board was provided at the entrance/exit gate and one would be able to find, in the station names on the board, slight vestiges concering former long-distance trains on the San'in line (because all trains in the direction of Kyoto that stopped at this station were bound for Kyoto, the display was fixed to "Kyoto" without being flapped), but the board was replaced with an electronic bulletin board in or around February 2008.

Formerly, a flipping/flapping type of train information display board was provided at the ticket gates and one would be able to find, in the station names on the board, slight vestiges concerning former long-distance trains on the Sanin line (because all trains in the direction of Kyoto that stopped at this station were bound for Kyoto, the display was fixed to 'Kyoto' without being flapped), but the board was replaced with an electronic bulletin board in or around February 2008.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーを削除し、Sanin としました。改札口→ticket gates としました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 京都市中央卸売市場第一市場
sen.e: The Central Wholesale Market of Kyoto City
The Central Wholesale Market of Kyoto City
The Central Wholesale Market of Kyoto City

sen.j: 京都リサーチパーク
sen.e: Kyoto Research Park
Kyoto Research Park
Kyoto Research Park

sen.j: 島原遊郭跡(嶋原を参照)
sen.e: The site of Shimabara-yukaku red-light district (also refer to Shimabara)
The site of the Shimabara-yukaku red-light district (also refer to the article on Shimabara)
The site of the Shimabara-yukaku red-light district (also refer to the article on Shimabara)

sen.j: マツモト_(京都府)五条店
sen.e: The Matsumoto Gojo store (in Kyoto Prefecture)
The Matsumoto Gojo store (in Kyoto Prefecture)
The Matsumoto (Kyoto Prefecture) Gojo store
sen.cmt: （京都府） の位置を変更しました。

sen.j: 五条通（国道9号）
sen.e: Gojo-dori Street (National Highway Route 9)
Gojo-dori Street (National Highway Route 9)
Gojo-dori Street (National Route 9)
sen.cmt: 国道→Naitonal Route としました。

sen.j: 千本通
sen.e: Sembon-dori Street
Sembon-dori Street
Senbon-dori Street
sen.cmt: Senbon とスペルを変更しました。

sen.j: この他、梅小路蒸気機関車館の最寄り駅にはなっているが、実際には南方へ800mほどの距離がある。
sen.e: Though this station is the nearest to Umekoji Steam Locomotive Museum, the distance to the museum is about 800 m in the south.
Though this station is the nearest to the Umekoji Steam Locomotive Museum, the museum is located approximately 800 m southward.
Though this station is the nearest to the Umekoji Steam Locomotive Museum, the museum is located approximately 800 m southward.

sen.j: 駅を北側に出た高架下に、京都-二条間高架化工事竣工の記念碑がある。
sen.e: Under the elevated structure on the north side of this station, a monument for the completion of the work for elevating the line between Kyoto Station and Nijo Station is placed.
Under the elevated structure on the north side of this station, there is a monument to the completion of the work of elevating the line between Kyoto Station and Nijo Station.
Under the elevated structure on the north side of this station, there is a monument to the completion of the work of elevating the line between Kyoto Station and Nijo Station.

sen.j: 京都リサーチパーク前
sen.e: Kyoto Research Park-mae (in fornt of KyotoResearch Park)
Kyoto Research Park-mae (in front of Kyoto Research Park)
Kyoto Research Park-mae (in front of Kyoto Research Park)

sen.j: バス停は駅前ではなく、駅から西へ徒歩2分の五条通沿いにある。
sen.e: The bus stop is not located in front of the station but along the Gojo-dori street, about two mintutes on foot from the station.
The bus stop isn't located in front of the station but is along the Gojo-dori street, about two mintutes on foot from the station.
The bus stop isn't located in front of the station but is along the Gojo-dori Street, about two minutes on foot westward from the station.
sen.cmt: 西方 を追加しました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 京都市営バス
sen.e: Kyoto City bus
Kyoto City bus
Kyoto City Bus

sen.j: 32系統：（平安神宮経由）慈照寺行／（西京極経由）京都外国語大学行
sen.e: Route 32: bound for Jisho-ji Temple (via Heian-jingu Shrine)/for Kyoto University of Foreign Studies (via Nishikyogoku)
Route 32: Bound for Jisho-ji Temple (via Heian-jingu Shrine)/for Kyoto University of Foreign Studies (via Nishikyogoku)
Route 32: Bound for Jisho-ji Temple (via Heian-jingu Shrine)/for Kyoto University of Foreign Studies (via Nishikyogoku)

sen.j: 43系統：烏丸駅行／久世橋東詰行
sen.e: Route 43: bound for Karasuma Station/for Kuzebashi Higashizume
Route 43: Bound for Karasuma Station / for Kuzebashi Higashizume
Route 43: Bound for Karasuma Station / for Kuzebashi Higashizume

sen.j: 73系統：京都駅行／（西京極経由）洛西バスターミナル行
sen.e: Route 73: bound for Kyoto Station/for Rakusai Bus Terminal (via Nishikyogoku)
Route 73: Bound for Kyoto Station / for Rakusai Bus Terminal (via Nishikyogoku)
Route 73: Bound for Kyoto Station / for Rakusai Bus Terminal (via Nishikyogoku)

sen.j: 75系統：（堀川五条経由）京都駅行／（双ヶ丘経由）東映太秦映画村、山越行
sen.e: Route 75: bound for Kyoto Station via Horikawa Gojo)/for Toei Uzumasa Eigamura (Toei Uzumasa movie village) (via Narabigaoka) or Yamagoe
Route 75: Bound for Kyoto Station via Horikawa Gojo) and/or for Toei Uzumasa Eigamura (Toei Uzumasa movie village) (via Narabigaoka) or Yamagoe
Route 75: Bound for Kyoto Station (via Horikawa Gojo) /for Toei Uzumasa Eigamura (Toei Uzumasa movie village) (via Narabigaoka), Yamagoe
sen.cmt: and /or → / としました。括弧を追加しました。

sen.j: 80系統：（五条通経由）祇園、河原町駅 (京都府)行／（西京極経由）京都外大前行
sen.e: Route 80: bound for Gion (via Gojo-dori Street)/for Kyoto University of Foreign Studies (via Nishikyogoku)
Route 80: Bound for Gion (via Gojo-dori Street) and/or for Kyoto University of Foreign Studies (via Nishikyogoku)
Route 80: Bound for Gion (via Gojo-dori Street), Kawaramachi Station (Kyoto Prefecture) / for Kyoto University of Foreign Studies (via Nishikyogoku)

sen.e: Keihan Kyoto Kotsu

sen.e: Route 21: bound for Kyoto Station-mae (in front of Kyoto Station)/for Katsurazaka-Chuo (via Shinbayashi Center and Minegado-cho)
Route 21: Bound for Kyoto Station-mae (in front of Kyoto Station) and/or for Katsurazaka-Chuo (via Shinbayashi Center and Minegado-cho)

Route 27: Bound for Kyoto Station and/or for Katsurazaka-Chuo (via Kokudo Kutsukake and Nishi-Katsurazaka)

sen.e: Gojo Sembon
Gojo Sembon
Gojo Senbon

sen.j: 上記の「京都リサーチパーク前」と同一の場所にある。
sen.e: Located at the same place as the stop for Kyoto Research Park-mae (in fornt of KyotoResearch Park)
Located at the same place as the stop for Kyoto Research Park-mae (in front of Kyoto Research Park)
Located at the same place as the stop for Kyoto Research Park-mae (in front of Kyoto Research Park)

sen.e: Kyoto Bus
Kyoto Bus
Kyoto Bus

sen.j: 1897年（明治30年）4月27日 京都鉄道の駅として開業。
sen.e: April 27, 1897: It started its operation as a station of Kyoto Electric Railway.
April 27, 1897: Operations commenced as a station of the Kyoto Electric Railway.
April 27, 1897: Operations commenced as a station of the Kyoto Electric Railway.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）8月1日 京都鉄道の国有化。
sen.e: Aufust 1, 1907: Kyoto Electric Railway was nationalized.
Aufust 1, 1907: The Kyoto Electric Railway was nationalized.
August 1, 1907: The Kyoto Electric Railway was nationalized.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 1918年（大正7年）9月10日 東海道本線貨物支線が開通。
sen.e: September 10, 1918: The cargo line branched from the Tokaido main line started its operation.
September 10, 1918: The cargo line that branched from the Tokaido main line went into operation.
September 10, 1918: The freight line that branched from the Tokaido Main Line went into operation.
sen.cmt: Main Line としました。cargo →freightに変更しました。

sen.j: 1927年（昭和2年）12月1日 京都市中央卸売市場への専用鉄道が開通。
sen.e: December 1, 1927: A railway line dedicated for the Kyoto central wholesale market was started its operation.
December 1, 1927: A railway line dedicated for use by the Kyoto central wholesale market went into operation.
December 1, 1927: A railway line dedicated for use by the Kyoto central wholesale market went into operation.

sen.j: 1976年（昭和51年）3月16日 高架駅化・北へ500メートル移転。
sen.e: March 16, 1976: It became an elevated station and its location was moved by 500 m to the north.
March 16, 1976: It became an elevated station, and its location was moved 500 m northward.
March 16, 1976: It became an elevated station, and its location was moved 500 m northward.

sen.j: 貨物取扱業務を新設の京都市場駅へ移管。
sen.e: The cargo-handling operation was transferred to Kyoto-shijo Station.
The cargo-handling operation was transferred to Kyoto-shijo Station.
The freight-handling operation was transferred to Kyoto-shijo Station.

sen.j: 1984年（昭和59年）2月1日 京都市場駅廃止。
sen.e: February 1, 1984: Kyoto-shijo Station was abolished.
February 1, 1984: Kyoto-shijo Station was abolished.
February 1, 1984: Kyoto-shijo Station was abolished.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987: Due to the division and privatization of JNR, it became a station of JR West.
April 1, 1987: Due to the division and privatization of JNR, it became a station of JR West.
April 1, 1987: Due to the division and privatization of JNR, it became a station of JR West.

The line branched from the Tokaido main line (for a connection with the San'in Line, with no passenger services provided).
